vulnerability.description: OpenBSD contains an overflow condition in the bcrypt_pbkdf() function in /external/bcrypt_pbkdf.c. The issue is triggered as user-supplied input is not properly validated. This may allow a remote attacker to cause a buffer overflow, resulting in a denial of service or potentially allowing the execution of arbitrary code.
vulnerability.exploit_def: The status of a working exploit is unknown.
vulnerability.title: OpenBSD BCrypt PBKDF Implementation /external/bcrypt_pbkdf.c bcrypt_pbkdf() Function Key Handling Remote Buffer Overflow
vulnerability.location_def: This vulnerability can be exploited over a wired network (e.g., LAN, WAN, Internet).
vulnerability.solution_def: The vulnerability can be mitigated with a vendor patch, or code available via a Revision Control System (RCS) such as CVS or SVN.
vulnerability.solution_desc: Currently, there are no known workarounds or upgrades to correct this issue. However, a patch has been committed to the source code repository (e.g. GIT, CVS, SVN) that addresses this vulnerability. Until it is incorporated into the next release of the software, manually patching an existing installation is the only known available solution. Check the vendor links in the references section for more information.

vulnerability.description: OpenSSL contains an overflow condition in the RC5_32_set_key() function in crypto/rc5/rc5_skey.c that is triggered as certain input is not properly validated when initializing encryption or decryption keys. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to cause a stack-based buffer overflow, resulting in a denial of service or potentially allowing the execution of arbitrary code.
vulnerability.exploit_def: A proof of concept is public. This is not a functioning exploit (e.g. for code execution), rather a method for demonstrating the vulnerability exists (e.g. crashing a program at a specific function).

vulnerability.solution_def: The solution status is unknown.
vulnerability.solution_desc: We are not currently aware of a solution for this vulnerability.

vulnerability.description: OpenSSL contains an overflow condition in the sm2_plaintext_size() function in crypto/sm2/sm2_crypt.c that is triggered as an incorrect, fixed overhead value is subtracted from the ciphertext length during SM2 decryption. This results in insufficient memory allocation and may allow a context-dependent attacker to cause a buffer overflow, resulting in a denial of service or potentially allowing the execution of arbitrary code.

vulnerability.description: Protocol Buffers (protobuf) contains a flaw in the UnknownFieldSet class in java/core/src/main/java/com/google/protobuf/UnknownFieldSet.java that is triggered when parsing binary data with unknown fields. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to consume system resource and hang a process using the library, potentially resulting in a denial of service.
vulnerability.exploit_def: A proof of concept is public. This is not a functioning exploit (e.g. for code execution), rather a method for demonstrating the vulnerability exists (e.g. crashing a program at a specific function).
vulnerability.title: Protocol Buffers (protobuf) UnknownFieldSet Class Unknown Fields Parsing Resource Consumption DoS

vulnerability.description: Zetetic SQLCipher contains a use-after-free error in the sqlcipher_codec_pragma() and sqlite3Strlen30() functions in sqlite3.c. The issue is triggered when handling a specially crafted SQL command sequence. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to dereference already freed memory and cause a denial of service in a process linked against the library.
vulnerability.exploit_def: The status of a working exploit is unknown.
vulnerability.title: Zetetic SQLCipher sqlite3.c Multiple Function Use-after-free DoS
vulnerability.location_def: To exploit this vulnerability, victim interaction is required (e.g., clicking a link, loading a file).

vulnerability.description: Zetetic SQLCipher contains a NULL pointer dereference flaw in the sqlcipher_exportFunc() function in crypto.c that is triggered as certain input to the sqlcipher_export() SQL function is not properly validated. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to crash a process linked against the library.
vulnerability.exploit_def: A working exploit is publicly available.
vulnerability.title: Zetetic SQLCipher crypto.c sqlcipher_exportFunc() Function NULL Pointer Dereference DoS

vulnerability.description: SQLite contains an integer overflow condition in the sqlite3_str_vappendf() function in printf.c that is triggered as floating-point conversions are not properly handled. This may allow a context-dependent attacker to exhaust available stack space and crash a process using the library.
vulnerability.exploit_def: A proof of concept is public. This is not a functioning exploit (e.g. for code execution), rather a method for demonstrating the vulnerability exists (e.g. crashing a program at a specific function).
vulnerability.title: SQLite printf.c sqlite3_str_vappendf() Function Integer Overflow Stack Exhaustion DoS
